definition: King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] overthrows tyrant Zhou of Shang 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2]
surname Wu
martial/military
surname Wang
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to rule/to reign over
to cut down/to fell/to dispatch an expedition against/to attack/to boast/Taiwan pr. [fa1]
saddle crupper (harness strap on horse's back)

sentences.english: The dance "Dawu"was composed by the Duke of Zhou after Emperor Wu successfully overthrew the Shang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 周乐《大武》，是武王伐纣胜利后由周公创编的。

definition: King Wu of Zhou (-1043), personal name Ji Fa 姬發|姬发, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 1046-1043 BC
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
King Wu of Zhou, personal name Ji Fa, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 西周[Xi1 Zhou1] 1046-771 BC
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province

King Wen of Zhou state (c. 1152-1056 BC), reigned c. 1099-1056 BC as king of Zhou state, leading figure in building the subsequent Western Zhou dynasty, father of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] the first Zhou dynasty king
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
saddle crupper (harness strap on horse's back)
Emperor Xin, last ruler of Shang (11th Century BC), famous as a tyrant
King Cheng of Zhou (1055-1021 BC), reigned 1042-1021 BC as the 2nd king of Western Zhou 西周[Xi1 Zhou1], son of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2]
Xia Dynasty (2070-1600 BC)
the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
Jizi, legendary sage from end of Shang dynasty (c. 1100 BC), said to have opposed the tyrant Zhòu 紂|纣 then ruled ancient Korea for Zhōu 周
